Definitively:

The movie was shot--around 60/40%--in two formats: Panavision with an aspect ratio of 2.39:1 and true (15/65mm) IMAX with an aspect ratio of 1.44:1.

The IMAX footage was all shot 'protected'* for a 1.78:1 or 16x9 frame as this dual aspect ratio presentation is what was always intended for the Bluray release (and is what was used on the Dark Knight Bluray).

You shouldn't really notice if you're not looking for it. If you did, good for you. It's still correct, though.

[*Due to the obscene size of the IMAX screen, one needs to leave more 'headroom' while framing closeups of the 15/65mm footage, placing the eyes at the centre of the frame as opposed to the top third. This is in order to avoid the audience having to look too high up. I imagine much of the conversion from 1.44 to 1.78 was just trimming this.]
